lead_paragraph: TILLEY--Maureen A. (nee Molloy), 67, died peacefully at home of pancreatic cancer on 3 April 2016. She was a Professor of Theology, Fordham University, since 2006. She previously taught at Florida State University and the University of Dayton. She attended Holy Trinity grammar school and Mary Star of the Sea High School in San Pedro, CA. She earned an A.B. (classical) from the University of San Francisco (1970), an M.A. from St. Michael's College (VT) in 1985, and a Ph.D. from Duke University in 1989. An internationally renowned scholar of late ancient North African Christianity, she was known as a challenging, supportive, and unfailingly fair teacher. She co-edited a book of essays, published an influential monograph on Donatism, over 70 scholarly articles, over 50 book reviews, and two volumes of translated texts. She served on the editorial boards of two journals: Theological Studies and Horizons. She was a past president of the North American Patristics Society. Maureen enjoyed opera. She delighted in travel and embroidery research that contributed to her scholarship. She was active in religious education in her parishes. She published brief parish histories and guides to the iconography of St. Mary and Holy Family parishes (Dayton, OH). Her many needlework projects included a large applique sanctuary hanging for Holy Cross Church (Durham, NC). She was and is beloved of many who survive her: friends and relatives, husband Terry, daughters Elena DeStefano (Bob) and Christine Dyer (Josh), granddaughter Jacquelyn Dyer, sisters Josette Molloy and Noelle Gervais. St. Paul's Church (60th and 9th) hosts visitation 11 April, 4:30 - 8:00pm and Funeral Mass, 12 April, 10am. Committal at Holy Cross Cemetery, Colma, CA, 19 April, 10am. 1/3
